arm_group.description: Cardiologist & Medical Resident auscultate using mechanical stethoscope
Cardiologist & Medical Resident auscultate using electronic stethoscope

brief_summary.textblock:
Auscultating Obese patients using the 3M Littmann Electronic Model 3200 Stethoscope is more
      effective in identifying referrable murmurs than using a traditional stethoscope.

clinical_study.brief_title: Auscultate Obese Patients Using Electronic and Traditional Stethoscopes

detailed_description.textblock:
Study will enroll subjects who have greater than 30 BMI ratings.  Each subject will receive
      4 auscultation examinations.  Two auscultations will be done by a cardiologist using both an
      acoustic traditional stethoscope and an electronic stethoscope.  Two additional
      auscultations will be done by a 3rd year medical resident also using both an acoustic
      traditional stethoscope and an electronic stethoscope.  All determinations will be compared
      to echocardiography results.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  Greater or equal than 18 years of age

          -  Referred for an echocardiogram

          -  obese, as defined as having a BMI greater than 30

          -  volunteers to participate in study

          -  agrees to provide copy of echocardiogram exam report

        Exclusion Criteria:

        -Investigator believes subject should not be included or is unsuitable for inclusion

study_pop.textblock:
Patients greater or equal to 18 years of age, with a BMI  greater than 30 and who have
        been scheduled for an echocadiogram examination

intervention.intervention_name: Auscultate with electronic or mechanical stethoscope (3M Littmann)

clinical_study.official_title: Study EM-05-012530 Benefit of Auscultation With 3M™ Littmann® 3200 Electronic Stethoscope to Diagnose Murmurs and Heart Pathologies in Overweight and Obese Patients With Increased Layers of Adipose Tissue

oversight_info.authority: Ministry of Health of the Republic of Lithuania: Lithuania

primary_outcome.measure: Most severe cardiac lesion identified by auscultation & echocardiography

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

secondary_outcome.measure: Secondary cardiac lesion identified by auscultation & echocardiography
Other heart sounds identified by auscultation & echocardiography

clinical_study.study_design: Observational Model: Cohort, Time Perspective: Prospective
